movies.title: Frank
movies.plot: Jon, a young wanna-be musician, discovers he's bitten off more than he can chew when he joins an eccentric pop band led by the mysterious and enigmatic Frank.
movies.simplePlot: Jon, a young wanna-be musician, discovers he's bitten off more than he can chew when he joins an eccentric pop band led by the mysterious and enigmatic Frank.

biography.bio: Domhnall Gleeson was born on May 12, 1983 in Dublin, Ireland. He is an actor and writer, known for Ex Machina (2014), The Revenant (2015) and About Time (2013).
biography.name: Domhnall Gleeson

biography.bio: Moira Brooker was born in 1957 in Croydon, Surrey, England. She is an actress, known for Frank (2014), As Time Goes By (1992) and Dummy (2008). She was previously married to Anthony Milner.
biography.name: Moira Brooker

biography.bio: Paul Butterworth is an award-winning film actor, British Actors' Equity member and full voting BAFTA member. Paul's father was a vicar and he was brought up in the North of England. He was the youngest of four children. His mother started teaching Paul speech and drama when he was eleven, she was the youngest ever gold Poetry Society winner in the 1930's and gave up a potential career in the West End to be a vicar's wife. Growing up there was a family of seven and a large garden where Paul developed his love of gardening and animals. They always kept chickens and he often helped out on local farms. His early childhood was spent in Walsden and at seven the family moved to Guildersome near Leeds. At eighteen he left home to go to the Central School of Speech and Drama in London. After leaving drama school he worked as an ASM at the Haymarket theatre Leicester, in children's theatre, in community theatre and in Rep at the Royal Exchange Manchester before starting his film and TV career. In the eighties and early nineties he was employed as an actor almost full time. Three months before filming The Full Monty in 1996 his son was born. Subsequently he shared child rearing duties and cut back on his acting work while always keeping his hand in with small TV and film jobs. Most of his work has been in TV and film with about 40 main cast TV and film credits. When his son started sixth form he started upgrading and updating his acting skills ready for when he left home. After seeing Michael Fassbender arrange an American voice coach on the read through for Frank in Dublin he contacted BAFTA LA and found a world renowned voice coach. Paul Butterworth is a full voting BAFTA member and started the BAFTA First Friday meet ups and the member for member BAFTA Facebook group in 2014. His LA voice coach Jon Sperry coached on movies and was Harvey Keitel's lifelong voice coach, and helped the likes of Philip Seymour Hoffman and Arnold Shwartznegger. Paul chose to study modern neutral American but has also been retraining his voice, taking acting direction and improving his ear and general acting skills. His son is starting his second year in Film School and Paul is now putting all his energies back into building his acting career. He would love to work back in the North of England. One of his lifelong hobbies is fine art and in 2016 he started studying with the Open College of the Arts - (validated by University of Creative Arts, London) and is enjoying Drawing1. Paul Butterworth has a new agent, photographs, and a short film in which he shot in Venice Beach in Easter 2016. He plays the co-lead with Jon Sperry. This is being professionally edited and color graded, scored by an Emmy nominated composer and the sound corrected by Matt Snowden at Chemical Audio. Paul will use this as an example of current work, playing a lead opposite an experienced professional actor, and market it to casting directors, directors and producers.
biography.name: Paul Butterworth

biography.bio: Phil Kingston is an actor and writer, known for Frank (2014), Judge Dredd (1995) and The Court Astronomer (2012).
biography.name: Phil Kingston

biography.bio: Billie Traynor is an actress, known for Frank (2014), The Hallow (2015) and Nostradamus and Me (2004).
biography.name: Billie Traynor

biography.bio: Shane O'Brien is an actor, known for Frank (2014) and Livestock (2009).
biography.name: Shane O'Brien

biography.bio: During the early 2000s, actor Scoot McNairy quickly came to specialize in portrayals of colorful and individualistic young men with a slightly rebellious edge. McNairy began during the early to mid-2000s, with bit parts in films including Wonderland (2003), Herbie: Fully Loaded (2005), and Art School Confidential (2006). He took his first bow as a producer with 2007's In Search of a Midnight Kiss, in which he also starred. That indie romantic comedy concerns a young man (McNairy) all washed up on New Year's Eve -- until an impulsive ad on Craigslist leads him to the great love of his life (Sara Simmonds) and an extraordinary night on the town.
biography.name: Scoot McNairy

biography.placeOfBirth: Lower East Side, Manhattan, New York City, New York, USA
biography.bio: Academy Award-nominated actress Maggie Gyllenhaal was born on November 16, 1977, on the Lower East Side of Manhattan in New York City. Her parents, Naomi Foner (née Achs) and Stephen Gyllenhaal, are both filmmakers, and her brother is actor Jake Gyllenhaal. Her mother is from an Ashkenazi Jewish family, while her father has Swedish, English, Swiss-German, and German ancestry. Maggie made her film debut in Stephen's film Waterland (1992). She had sporadic roles throughout her teenage years, though she stepped away to receive a degree in literature from Columbia University in 1999. In addition, she studied briefly at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Arts in London, which helped with her post-graduation transition back in to acting. Soon after graduation, Gyllenhaal appeared in supporting roles in Cecil B. Demented (2000) and alongside brother Jake Gyllenhaal in Donnie Darko (2001). Her breakout role came a bit later, when she took on the daring, sexy title role in Secretary (2002). That part wound up earning her a Golden Globe nomination, and Gyllenhaal followed that up with supporting turns in 40 Days and 40 Nights (2002), Confessions of a Dangerous Mind (2002), Adaptation. (2002), and Mona Lisa Smile (2003), among other movies. Gyllenhaal received her second Golden Globe nomination for playing a recent prison parolee in Sherrybaby (2006). She followed that up with roles in World Trade Center (2006) and Stranger Than Fiction (2006), and then replaced Katie Holmes in the role of Rachel Dawes in The Dark Knight (2008). In 2009, Gyllenhaal received great acclaim for her role opposite Jeff Bridges in Crazy Heart (2009), which earned the actress her first Oscar nomination. Since then, Gyllenhaal has been seen in Nanny McPhee Returns (2010), Hysteria (2011) and Won't Back Down (2012). Gyllenhaal has two children with husband Peter Sarsgaard, whom she married in 2009.
biography.name: Maggie Gyllenhaal

biography.bio: François Civil was born on January 29, 1989 in Paris, France. He is an actor, known for As Above, So Below (2014), Frank (2014) and Five (2016).
biography.name: François Civil

biography.bio: Carla Azar is a northamerican musician, known mainly for being the drummer of the trio Autolux. She is noted for her role as 'Nana' in the film _Frank (II) (2014)_ , where she plays a drummer. Carla is a multi-instrumentalist, and has collaborated with musicians like John Frusciante, PJ Harvey and Jack White. Carla and fellow band-mate Eugene Goreshter met when both of them were working on the score of the play "Accidental Death of an Anarchist", from Nobel Prize winner, Dario Fo. Carla had met Greg Edwards when they both where touring with their former bands (Carla with Ednaswap and Greg with Failure). Eventually, the three of them formed Autolux in 2000, with Carla on drums and vocals, Eugene Goreshter on bass and vocals and Greg Edwards on guitar and vocals.
biography.name: Carla Azar

biography.bio: Chris McHallem was born in 1960 in London, England. He is an actor and writer, known for Girl with a Pearl Earring (2003), Frank (2014) and Becoming Jane (2007).
biography.name: Chris McHallem

biography.bio: Michael Fassbender was born in Heidelberg, Germany, to a German father, Josef, and an Irish mother, Adele (originally from Larne, County Antrim, in Northern Ireland). Michael was raised in the town of Killarney, Co. Kerry, in south-west Ireland, where his family moved to when he was two years old. His parents ran a restaurant (his father is a chef). Fassbender is based in London, England, and became known in the U.S. after his role in the Quentin Tarantino's Inglourious Basterds (2009). In 2011, Fassbender debuted as the Marvel antihero Magneto in the prequel X-Men: First Class (2011); he would go on to share the role with Ian McKellen in X-Men: Days of Future Past (2014). Also in 2011, Fassbender's performance as a sex addict in Shame (2011) received critical acclaim. He won the Volpi Cup for Best Actor at the Venice Film Festival and was nominated for Golden Globe and BAFTA Awards. In 2013, his role as slave owner Edwin Epps in slavery epic 12 Years a Slave (2013) was similarly praised, earning him his first Oscar nomination, for Best Supporting Actor. 12 Years a Slave marked Fassbender's third collaboration with Steve McQueen, who also directed Hunger and Shame. In 2013, Fassbender appeared in another Ridley Scott film, The Counsellor (2013). In 2015, he portrayed Steve Jobs (2015) in the Danny Boyle-directed biopic of the same name, and played Macbeth (2015) in Justin Kurzel's adaptation of William Shakespeare's play. For the former, he has received Academy Award, BAFTA, Golden Globe and SAG nominations for Best Actor. As well as acting, Fassbender produced the 2015 western Slow West (2015), which he also starred in.
biography.name: Michael Fassbender

biography.bio: Michael James Ford is an actor, known for Frank (2014), Becoming Jane (2007) and Michael Collins (1996).
biography.name: Michael James Ford

biography.bio: Rosalind Adler is an actress, known for Frank (2014), Ella and the Mothers (2002) and This Could Be the Last Time (1998).
biography.name: Rosalind Adler
